bramspr.symboltable

Class CompositeSymbol

  • java.lang.Object
    • bramspr.symboltable.Symbol
      • bramspr.symboltable.TypeSymbol
        • bramspr.symboltable.CompositeSymbol

  • public class CompositeSymbol
extends TypeSymbol
    Objects of this class are symbol table entries associated with composite types in a Bramspr-program. On top of the information TypeSymbol already specifies, a composite type has fields, so this class specifies the properties and methods for this feature. As built-in types are implemented as composite types, this class also defines the property primitive, indicating whether the object in question is the symbol of such a built-in type. In addition, this class contains some functionality for fixing JVM naming issues.

      • getDescriptor

        public java.lang.String getDescriptor()
        Returns the name of the class as it is called in Java and the filesystem (excl. extension). Examples: "composite$CA", or "I"
        Specified by:
        getDescriptor in class TypeSymbol
        Parameters:
        outerClassName - the name of the containing class
        Returns:
        String representation of descriptor.

      • getSignature

        public java.lang.String getSignature()
        Returns the signature, e.g. "Ljava/lang/String;", "Lcomposite$CA;", "I" or "Z"
        Overrides:
        getSignature in class TypeSymbol
        Returns:
        signature as used by the JVM

      • setDescriptor

        public java.lang.String setDescriptor(java.lang.String outerClassName,
                             int number)
        Attempt to set the descriptor of the type in the style the compiler refers to it. This is of the format outerclass$C[A-Z]+. Only sets the value if no value was set yet.
        Parameters:
        number - the identifier of the type, must be unique for every type.
        Returns:
        the inner class name of this type

      • i2s

        private java.lang.String i2s(int number)
        Converts numbers to Strings. The format is "CA", "CB" ... "CZ", "CAA", "CAB", etc.
